Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Description: Rotech Medical Corporation agreed to pay the United States $17 million to resolve allegations that the company fraudulently overbilled government health care programs for respiratory equipment, supplies and services.

Rotech Medical, Inc., and its subsidiary Community Home Oxygen of Montana (also known as Community Oxygen Services, Inc.) paid $526,000 to Montana to settle allegations the company overbilled the state Medicaid program. This was part of a larger $17 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-rotech-medical-corporation
